sentences.sContent: ...W：I was so angry yesterday! My biology teacher did not even let me explain why I missed the field trip...
...many were at a loss to explain it...
...but they also are less inclined to explain their tears...
...Wilsons of the world as the painful obligation to explain the racial facts of life to someone who hadn't quite learned them yet...
...Now how can we explain these very different results...
...I'm having a lot of trouble with logic and it seems my professor can't explain it in a way that makes sense to me...
...But now I don't know how to explain that feeling of peacefulness without explaining how hard you have to work for it...
...understanding the values of another culture helps explain how people think and act...

phrases.pCn: 为自己辩解；说明自己意图

trans.tranOther: to tell someone about something in a way that is clear or easy to understand
